verses.verse: Now Naaman,<WH5283> captain<WH8269> of the host<WH6635> of the king<WH4428> of Syria,<WH758> was<WH1961> a great<WH1419> man<WH376> with<WH6440> his master,<WH113> and honorable,<WH5375> <WH6440> because<WH3588> by him the LORD<WH3068> had given<WH5414> deliverance<WH8668> unto Syria:<WH758> he was<WH1961> also a mighty<WH1368> man<WH376> in valor,<WH2428> but he was a leper.<WH6879>

And it came to pass,<WH1961> when the king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478> had read<WH7121> <WH853> the letter,<WH5612> that he rent<WH7167> his clothes,<WH899> and said,<WH559> Am I<WH589> God,<WH430> to kill<WH4191> and to make alive,<WH2421> that<WH3588> this<WH2088> man doth send<WH7971> unto<WH413> me to recover<WH622> a man<WH376> of his leprosy?<WH4480> <WH6883> wherefore<WH3588> <WH389> consider,<WH3045> I pray you,<WH4994> and see<WH7200> how<WH3588> he<WH1931> seeketh a quarrel<WH579> against me.

And it was<WH1961> so, when Elisha<WH477> the man<WH376> of God<WH430> had heard<WH8085> that<WH3588> the king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478> had rent<WH7167> <WH853> his clothes,<WH899> that he sent<WH7971> to<WH413> the king,<WH4428> saying,<WH559> Wherefore<WH4100> hast thou rent<WH7167> thy clothes?<WH899> let him come<WH935> now<WH4994> to<WH413> me, and he shall know<WH3045> that<WH3588> there is<WH3426> a prophet<WH5030> in Israel.<WH3478>

And Elisha<WH477> sent<WH7971> a messenger<WH4397> unto<WH413> him, saying,<WH559> Go<WH1980> and wash<WH7364> in Jordan<WH3383> seven<WH7651> times,<WH6471> and thy flesh<WH1320> shall come again<WH7725> to thee, and thou shalt be clean.<WH2891>

And Naaman<WH5283> said,<WH559> Shall there not<WH3808> then, I pray thee,<WH4994> be given<WH5414> to thy servant<WH5650> two mules'<WH6776> <WH6505> burden<WH4853> of earth?<WH127> for<WH3588> thy servant<WH5650> will henceforth<WH5750> offer<WH6213> neither<WH3808> burnt offering<WH5930> nor sacrifice<WH2077> unto other<WH312> gods,<WH430> but<WH3588> <WH518> unto the LORD.<WH3068>

In this<WH2088> thing<WH1697> the LORD<WH3068> pardon<WH5545> thy servant,<WH5650> that when my master<WH113> goeth<WH935> into the house<WH1004> of Rimmon<WH7417> to worship<WH7812> there,<WH8033> and he<WH1931> leaneth<WH8172> on<WH5921> my hand,<WH3027> and I bow myself<WH7812> in the house<WH1004> of Rimmon:<WH7417> when I bow down myself<WH7812> in the house<WH1004> of Rimmon,<WH7417> the LORD<WH3068> pardon<WH5545> thy servant<WH5650> in this<WH2088> thing.<WH1697>
And he said<WH559> unto him, Go<WH1980> in peace.<WH7965> So he departed<WH1980> from<WH4480> <WH854> him a little way.<WH3530> <WH776>

But Gehazi,<WH1522> the servant<WH5288> of Elisha<WH477> the man<WH376> of God,<WH430> said,<WH559> Behold,<WH2009> my master<WH113> hath spared<WH2820> <WH853> Naaman<WH5283> this<WH2088> Syrian,<WH761> in not receiving<WH4480> <WH3947> at his hands<WH4480> <WH3027> <WH853> that which<WH834> he brought:<WH935> but,<WH3588> <WH518> as the LORD<WH3068> liveth,<WH2416> I will run<WH7323> after<WH310> him, and take<WH3947> somewhat<WH3972> of<WH4480> <WH854> him.

So Gehazi<WH1522> followed<WH7291> after<WH310> Naaman.<WH5283> And when Naaman<WH5283> saw<WH7200> him running<WH7323> after<WH310> him, he lighted down<WH5307> from<WH4480> <WH5921> the chariot<WH4818> to meet<WH7122> him, and said,<WH559> Is all well?<WH7965>

And Naaman<WH5283> said,<WH559> Be content,<WH2974> take<WH3947> two talents.<WH3603> And he urged<WH6555> him, and bound<WH6696> two talents<WH3603> of silver<WH3701> in two<WH8147> bags,<WH2754> with two<WH8147> changes<WH2487> of garments,<WH899> and laid<WH5414> them upon<WH413> two<WH8147> of his servants;<WH5288> and they bore<WH5375> them before<WH6440> him.

But he<WH1931> went in,<WH935> and stood<WH5975> before<WH413> his master.<WH113> And Elisha<WH477> said<WH559> unto<WH413> him, Whence<WH4480> <WH370> comest thou, Gehazi?<WH1522> And he said,<WH559> Thy servant<WH5650> went<WH1980> no<WH3808> whither.<WH575> <WH575>

Is it a time<WH6256> to receive<WH3947> <WH853> money,<WH3701> and to receive<WH3947> garments,<WH899> and oliveyards,<WH2132> and vineyards,<WH3754> and sheep,<WH6629> and oxen,<WH1241> and menservants,<WH5650> and maidservants?<WH8198>
